TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWsdlImportExtension

Docs.summary: Implement and attach to a object to control how the importer maps Web Services Description Language (WSDL) parts to those of a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> interface to control the mapping between WSDL and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> objects, especially when reading custom WSDL extensions to modify your contract or endpoint information. Then attach your custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> object to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlImporter> either programmatically or by using an application configuration file. You can also attach your custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> object to the internal <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlImporter> used by the [ServiceModel Metadata Utility Tool (Svcutil.exe)](/dotnet/framework/wcf/servicemodel-metadata-utility-tool-svcutil-exe) using an application configuration file.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension.ImportContract%2A> method is called to import a contract.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension.BeforeImport%2A> method to modify the metadata that is then imported into <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> objects.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> to add an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=nameWithType> and an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=nameWithType> (the `WsdlDocumentationImporter`, in this case) to modify generated WCF client code at the interface and operation level.
[!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationimporter.cs#4)]
The following code example shows how to configure the client metadata system to use the custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> from an application configuration file.
[!code-xml[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/client.exe.config#9)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void BeforeImport (System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection wsdlDocuments, System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet xmlSchemas, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Xml.XmlElement> policy);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BeforeImport(class System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection wsdlDocuments, class System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet xmlSchemas, class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class System.Xml.XmlElement> policy) cil managed
Public Sub BeforeImport (wsdlDocuments As ServiceDescriptionCollection, xmlSchemas As XmlSchemaSet, policy As ICollection(Of XmlElement))

public: void BeforeImport(System::Web::Services::Description::ServiceDescriptionCollection ^ wsdlDocuments, System::Xml::Schema::XmlSchemaSet ^ xmlSchemas, System::Collections::Generic::ICollection<System::Xml::XmlElement ^> ^ policy);

Docs.param: The schema collection to be used when importing.
The policy assertions used when importing.
Docs.summary: Called prior to importing metadata documents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension.BeforeImport%2A> methods of all registered <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> objects is called before anything is imported from the supplied metadata.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImportContract(class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlImporter importer, class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlContractConversionContext context) cil managed
Public Sub ImportContract (importer As WsdlImporter, context As WsdlContractConversionContext)

Docs.param: The import context to be modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension.ImportContract%2A> method is called when a contract is being imported. You can modify the contract or insert other exporting behaviors such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=nameWithType> and an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=nameWithType> objects to modify the code that is generated for the contract.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> to add an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=nameWithType> and an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=nameWithType> (the `WsdlDocumentationImporter`, in this case) to modify generated WCF client code at the interface and operation level.
[!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationimporter.cs#4)]
The following code example shows how to configure the client metadata system to use the custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension> from an application configuration file.
[!code-xml[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/client.exe.config#9)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImportEndpoint(class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlImporter importer, class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext context) cil managed
Public Sub ImportEndpoint (importer As WsdlImporter, context As WsdlEndpointConversionContext)

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension.ImportEndpoint%2A> method is called when importing an endpoint. Modify the context properties to customize the imported endpoint.
